title: 2-bag-of-marbles
text:
3. turing modeling

3.1 define model

using Turing
    include("utils.jl")

    @model function bag_of_marbles(start::Array{Int}=[4,8,6],first::Int=1)

        white = 1
        blue  = 2
        red   = 3
        colors = [white,blue,red]

        draw0 ~ Categorical(simplex([start[white],start[blue],start[red]]))
        if draw0 == first
            draw1 ~ Categorical(simplex([start[white]-1,start[blue],start[red]]))
        elseif draw0==first
            draw1 ~ Categorical(simplex([start[white],start[blue]-1,start[red]]))
        else
            # red
            draw1 ~ Categorical([start[white],start[blue],start[red]-1]|>simplex);
        end

        true ~ Dirac(draw0 == first)

    end

title: 3-cookie-problem
text:
4. turing modeling

4.1 define model

    include("./utils.jl")
    using Turing

    "pickup å–å‡ºçš„ cookie, 1: vanilla,2: chocolate"
    @model function cookie_problem(pickup::Int=1)
        vanilla = 1
        chocolate = 2
        
        bowl1 = 1
        bowl2 = 2
        
        bowl ~ DiscreteUniform(bowl1,bowl2)
        cookie ~ (bowl == bowl1) ? Categorical(simplex([30,10])) : 
                                Categorical(simplex([20,20]))
        true ~ Dirac(cookie == pickup)

    end

"å®šä¹‰è¢‹å­ç±»å‹"
struct Bag
    red::Int
    blue::Int
    green::Int
end

"""
æšä¸¾é™å®šçƒç§ç±»
@ref:snippetslab://snippet/6016DF64-9B90-420E-83F7-7C6FF7D4A139
"""
@enum Ball red = 1 blue = 2 green = 3

function new_bag_space_prob(bag::Bag, pick::Ball=red)::Tuple{Bag,Real}
    (; red, blue, green) = bag # struct è§£æ„
    ball = Int(pick) # @enum ç±»å‹éœ€è¦è½¬æ¢ä¸ºæ•´å‹
    prob_size = +(red, blue, green)  # åˆè®¡çƒæ€»æ•°
    res::Tuple{Bag,Real} = if ball == 1
        (Bag([red - 1, blue, green]...), red // prob_size)
    elseif ball == 2
        (Bag([red, blue - 1, green]...), blue // prob_size)
    else
        (Bag([red, blue, green - 1]...), green // prob_size)
    end
    return res
end

bag = Bag(15, 18, 10)
res1 = new_bag_space_prob(bag, red)
res2 = new_bag_space_prob(res1[1], red)
both_red_ball=res1[2] * res2[2]

title: 1. question
text:
Note



from hakank-bayes-code
Urns and balls
urn1 contains 40 blue balls and 20 red balls urn2 contains 25 blue balls and 30 red balls.
throw a fair coin to descide to choos which urn, head for urn1, tail for urn2 â€œWhat is the probability of drawing a blue ball?â€
The exact answer of drawing a blue call is 0.540/60 + 0.525/55 = 0.56060606060606060606

3. turing model

3.1 define model

    using Turing,Distributions
    include("./utils.jl")
    

    @model function urns_and_balls()
        tail = 1
        head = 2
        coin ~ Categorical(simplex([0.5,0.5]))
        
        blue = 1
        red = 2
        urn1=Categorical(simplex([40,20]))
        urn2=Categorical(simplex([25,30]))
        draw ~ coin == head ? urn1 : urn2 
    end

urns_and_balls (generic function with 2 methods)

    chns = sample(model, IS(), 40_000)
    display(chns)
